title: ETH deposits and withdrawals available on Arbitrum! - Kraken Blog
summary: Kraken now supports Ethereum (ETH) deposits and withdrawals on Arbitrum, a Layer 2 blockchain protocol built on top of Ethereum. This increases the efficiency of Ethereum transactions and reduces transaction costs. Arbitrum allows developers to create and execute Ethereum-compatible smart contracts, and funding is already live. However, ETH deposits and withdrawals on the Kraken Pro App and Kraken App will not be available at launch. Users can transfer ETH to their Kraken account by selecting "Arbitrum One Network" in the deposit method drop-down box.

title: Macro Guru Raoul Pal Predicts $10,000 Ethereum – But Says Other ETH Rivals Will Outperform - The Daily Hodl
summary: Macro Guru Raoul Pal predicts $10,000 Ethereum, but other rivals may outperform. Ethereum is the "money of the internet" but may not be the best performer due to innovation and network effects. Other altcoins like Sui, Aptos, Solana, and Polygon have potential for higher gains. Pal has a rough price target of $10,000 for ETH but is hesitant to make price predictions.

title: Coin Bureau Predicts Ethereum Flippening Next Bull Cycle, Says One Altcoin Still Has Major Upside - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Coin Bureau's Guy Turner predicts Ethereum will eventually surpass Bitcoin in market cap, but it's not a big deal. He sees Ethereum growing due to its versatility and constant upgrades, and is closely watching Cosmos (ATOM) which he thinks has yet to fulfill its potential. Ethereum is trading at $1,524, while ATOM is at $13.48.

title: Ethereum price drops 9% after Kraken's SEC settlement - Yahoo Finance UK
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum price dropped 9% after Kraken agreed to settle with the SEC over its staking service. The SEC charged Kraken with offering unregistered securities through its staking-as-a-service program. The regulator wants crypto exchanges to register financial instruments as securities before offering them to customers. The settlement includes a $30m fine and ending staking services for US customers. The global cryptocurrency market cap fell 1.6% to $1.05tn.

title: Vitalik Buterin donates $227K to help earthquake victims in Turkey - Cointelegraph
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has donated $227,000 to help earthquake victims in Turkey and Syria. He has sent 50 ETH (approximately $77,000) to Anka Relief, a crypto aid fund and community, and an additional 99 ETH (worth $150,000) to Ahbap, a nongovernmental and nonprofit organization dedicated to relief efforts in Turkey. The latest donation brings the total amount donated by Buterin to $4.3 million in crypto donations. Other companies, including Binance, have also donated significant amounts to support Turkish relief efforts.

title: Arbitrum-Based GMX Surpassed Ethereum Blockchain in Daily Fees Over Weekend - CoinDesk
summary: Arbitrum-based GMX surpassed Ethereum in daily fees over the weekend, according to CoinDesk. This is a significant achievement for GMX, which is an Ethereum-based decentralized exchange (DEX) that has been gaining popularity in recent months. The news suggests that GMX is attracting more trading volume and user activity than Ethereum, which has been the dominant blockchain in the cryptocurrency space for several years. This could be a sign of growing interest in decentralized exchanges and the broader Web3 ecosystem. title: Can ETH pull off a strong bounce back as exchange balances reach 4-year lows? - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) bears are losing momentum after a recent pullback, with exchange balances reaching 4-year lows. The cryptocurrency's price tag is $1534, representing a 9% pullback in the last five days. On-chain metrics are leaning in favor of bullish expectations, with ETH flowing out of exchanges and into DeFi, and the total value of ETH locked in ETH 2.0 deposit contracts reaching a new ATH. However, the funding rate is still downward, indicating a lack of strong demand. The outcome is subject to potential FUD and another unexpected selloff.

title: How to Bridge to Ethereum Layer 2s - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

🚀 How to Bridge to Ethereum Layer 2s 🚀

Popularity is a problem for Ethereum, causing high network congestion and expensive transactions. 💸

Layer-2 blockchains are built on top of Ethereum and offer faster, cheaper, and more efficient transactions. 🚀

Choose an L2 scaling solution: 🤔

1. ZK rollups (StarkNet, Loopring, zkEVM) - transactions finalize almost instantly, but fees are higher. 🕒
2. Optimistic rollups (Arbitrum, Optimism) - assume transactions are valid, with a challenge period to dispute fraudulent transactions. 🔍
3. Sidechains (Polygon PoS) - operate separately from Ethereum with their own validators and consensus processes. 🔓

title: Bitcoin Ready for New Leg Up As Ethereum Flashes ‘Perfect’ Price Pattern: Popular Analyst - The Daily Hodl
summary: Bitcoin (BTC) is poised for a new leg up according to a popular crypto analyst, who correctly predicted the 2018 market bottom. Smart Contracter, a pseudonymous analyst with 220,300 Twitter followers, believes that BTC has completed its corrective period and could rally to $25,500. He is also tracking Ethereum (ETH) and Litecoin (LTC), with ETH flashing a bullish signal and LTC showing bullish signals against BTC. The analyst uses Elliott Wave theory to predict future price action, and advises investors to do their own research before making any high-risk investments in cryptocurrency.

title: Aave deploys DAI stablecoin competitor on Ethereum - crypto.news
summary: Aave, a decentralized finance protocol, has launched its algorithmic stablecoin GHO on Ethereum, backed by multiple crypto assets. GHO is an alternative to DAI, the largest algorithmic stablecoin, and aims to provide transparency and community ownership. The GHO stablecoin is issued and managed by AaveDAO, a decentralized autonomous organization, and revenue will be allocated to community contributors. Despite the transparency offered by decentralized stablecoins, their centralized counterparts still dominate the market. GHO trades at $0.993870 with a total supply of 2,267,933 GHO.

title: Wormhole hacker moves another $46M of stolen funds - Cointelegraph
summary: Wormhole hacker moves $46M of stolen funds: The hacker behind the $321M Wormhole exploit has moved another $46M of stolen funds, with $41.4M in Lido Finance-wrapped Ethereum and $5M in Rocket Pool Ethereum staking tokens transferred to MakerDAO. The hacker appears to be seeking yield or arbitrage opportunities, exchanging the assets for 16.6M DAI and then wrapping them back into 9,700 wstETH. The move comes just weeks after the hacker moved another $155M worth of Ethereum to a decentralized exchange.

title: Yereq Geo Token, designed on the Ethereum network, the Ultimate Solution for EV Charging Services. - Yahoo Finance
summary: Yereq Geo Token, on Ethereum network, offers solution for EV charging services. App allows users to charge EVs without membership accounts or credit cards. Token can be used as payment method and system of rewards for EV charging station operators. Platform combines technology and conventional assets. CEO, George E. Bingham, has experience in building multiple successful organizations. Yereq Geo Energy is a deflationary and decentralized token accepted as payment for EV charging online.

title: Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin Donates 150 ETH to Help Earthquake Victims in Türkiye - DailyCoin
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has donated 150 ETH (approximately $200,000) to support earthquake relief efforts in Türkiye. Buterin has also been active in philanthropy in recent years, donating millions to various causes including medical research, Ukrainian charities, and COVID-19 relief funds. He has used Ethereum-based mixers, including Tornado Cash, to make some of these donations despite their ban by the U.S. Treasury Department.

title: Infura is to blame for MetaMask's violation of the crypto spirit - Cointelegraph
summary: Infura, an API provider, is being blamed for violating the "crypto spirit" by collecting users' IP and Ether wallet addresses through MetaMask, a popular Ethereum browser wallet. Many in the crypto community are concerned about the privacy implications of this action, as it raises questions about the control and ownership of user data. The article suggests that API providers like Infura are not obligated to be censorship-resistant, which can make users vulnerable to censorship without prior notification. The author suggests that users should monitor API providers and notify communities when they behave unethically, and that wallets should inform users immediately and clarify the terms of their privacy. Additionally, the article proposes that technology should be developed to address this concern, such as API node-as-a-service, which makes it easy for non-tech users to spin up API nodes for their wallets.

title: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin offers aid for earthquake victims in Turkey - India Today
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin has donated $150,000 worth of ETH to aid earthquake victims in Turkey and Syria, with an additional $77,000 donated to Anka relief. The crypto industry has also shown support, with over $10 million in cryptocurrency donated to relief efforts.

title: Wormhole hacker moves $46 million of stolen funds - AMBCrypto News
summary: Hacker moves $46 million of stolen Wormhole funds, transferring assets to MakerDAO and decentralized exchange OpenOcean. The hacker appears to be seeking yield or arbitrage opportunities on their stolen loot, with the assets exchanged for 16.6 million DAI and then used to purchase ETH and stETH. The latest transfer comes after the hacker sent $155 million in Ethereum to a decentralized exchange last month.

title: Cryptocurrency price in India 13 February 2023: Bitcoin up 0.05% & Ethereum down 0.92%, market traded mixed - India Today
summary: Cryptocurrency prices in India saw a mixed trading session on February 13, with Bitcoin up slightly and Ethereum down. The global crypto market cap declined by 0.49%, while the total crypto market volume saw an increase of 24.59%. Top gainers and losers included Render Token, Stacks, Ziliqa, and Internet computer, while meme coins like Shiba Inu and Dogecoin saw negative impacts. Metaverse tokens like Decentraland, Axie Infinity, and The Sandbox also suffered losses.

title: Cryptocurrency Price Today: Bitcoin Fails To Pick Up Steam As Global Market Cap Continues To Slide - ABP Live
summary: Bitcoin and other major cryptocurrencies are trading down, with the global market cap on track to lose the $1 trillion mark. Bitcoin failed to break above $22,000 over the weekend, while other popular altcoins saw mixed gains and losses. The Render Token was the top gainer, up 13.87%, while Stacks, Ziliqa, Internet Computer, and Oasis Network also posted significant gains. Hedera, Mina, Optimism, Fantom, and The Graph were among the top losers. Exchanges are cautioning investors about the current market scenario, with regulatory uncertainty and higher-than-expected inflation contributing to the volatility.

title: Ethereum: crypto donations for Turkey - The Cryptonomist
summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin donated $150,000 to help earthquake victims in Turkey. He gave 99 ETH to Ahbap and 50 ETH to Anka Relief. Other cryptocurrencies like AVAX, USDT, TRX, and crypto exchanges are also providing donations. The total amount of donations has exceeded $1 million.
